main event: A silver streak was observed over Birmingham, Alabama on April 10, 1958, moving at an extremely high rate of speed.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for about 1 minute with the object appearing to drop off or disappear,The object's course was described at a 40-degree angle,The report was generated by Major Edward H Avie and Captain Donald J. Lang,An aircraft was suspected to be dropping or jettisoning bombs or fuel tanks,No insignia was observed on the flying object.
witness description: Major Edward H Avie, Captain Donald J. Lang
